radiographic_examinations.findings: No bacterial pathogens and no parasites.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Case 5 returned 3 days later for CBC and fixed stool collection 40 days after onset of symptoms, where the absolute eosinophil count was 4.7 × 10⁹/L and revealed E. nana and large numbers of D. fragilis.

radiographic_examinations.findings: High numbers of D. fragilis, along with B. hominis and E. nana.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years prior, it was normal.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Absolute eosinophil count was 0.9 × 10⁹/L, stool microscopy revealed only D. fragilis.
6 stool specimens did not reveal any parasites.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Three years prior, a routine CBC revealed an eosinophil count of 0.1 × 10⁹/L.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed positive for D. fragilis on pretreatment specimens.
All cases remained symptom free and the absolute eosinophil count had returned to normal in all cases.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: All eosinophil counts had normalized to 0.2 × 10⁹/L.
